title.narrative: F.a: Disaster risk reduction in Legeheda

description.narrative: The project develops the disaster preparedness of the people in the Legeheda region and improves their living conditions. Legeheda in northern Ethiopia is a region where natural disasters like drought, flooding and other consequences of the climate change are very common. The project will improve the resilience of the community to disaster risks with five results: increased awareness and disaster preparedness of the community, improved livelihood security and asset building, improved environmental rehabilit ation, improved access to safe drinking water, and women socioeconomic empowerment. The project will raise the awareness of the community on disaster risk reduction and climate change. Community conversation will be conducted and community and woreda livel ihood and DRR coordinating committees will be strengthened. Training will be given to project staff and government experts on disaster risk reduction mechanisms, climate change adaptation and mitigation, and school environmental clubs will be strengthened. The project will also give emphasis in making use of available water resources for crop production through small-scale irrigation and introducing high yielding and high value crops like vegetables, potato, and highland fruits. Environmental rehabilitation will be given due consideration by closing degraded areas, employing different physical and biological soil and water conservation activities. Firewood efficient stoves and renewable energy will be introduced to minimize the pressure on the scarce vegetat ion in the area. Access to safe drinking water will be achieved through spring protection, hand-dug well construction, training of water committee members and providing maintenance tools. Women will be empowered by organizing them into self-help groups (SH Gs), training of SHG leaders, provide start-up capital, distribution of breeding sheep for women, and training of women in home economics. The implementing agency is the Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus- Development and Social Services Commission- North Central Synod (EECMY-DASSC-NCS) in Dessie.
